sourceOfFunds.purpose: Worked with Chhattisgarh Forest department in consultancy mode to Replenish Rare Endangered and threatened medicinal Plants in different forest ranges of Chhattisgarh like Doka,l Khairagarh, rajnandgaon,keregaon etc. In total plantation was conducted in 1545 ha of land. yearly turnover of the work was nearly Rs 35, 46000.

The project was carried out by forest department Chhattisgarh and we were assigned the task of plantation under green iindia mission in 3300ha of land .planted Kullu,neem,mudhi,bahera,harra,kachnar trees along with plantation of Satavar and sarpgandha in MPCA of various sites in the district of kabirdham-pandariya and adjoining ranges.
Forest Department of Chhattisgarh Project, continuation of green India NMPB aided project.

The project was running in continuation of the previous years. plantations were conducted in the katghora ,khairagarh divisions of CG. Assorted other farmer groups were also motivated through trainings.
Much of the plantations were done MPCA areas and some assorted bamboo plantations were conducted by farmers as ex situ conservation methods. Nursery also established.
